intro: Galium chlorophyllum, commonly known as green wood-remedies, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny white or greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a common component of understory vegetation in temperate regions.
